title: Local Data Collection
text: inverters collect historical data, may want collection R. ideas achieve .

title: Local Data Collection
text: Initialize board dataset maned “inverter_data” () can choose simpler board local board Read {pins} local board content dataset “inverter_data” Read new data inverter append dataset : look recorded versions
code: library(pins) board <- board_local() if (!"inverter_data" %in% pin_list(board)) {   initial_data <- tibble::tibble(     date = Sys.time(), get_output_data(c("192.168.0.175"))     )   board |> pin_write(initial_data, name = "inverter_data", versioned = TRUE) } history <- board |> pin_read("inverter_data") new_data <- tibble::tibble(   date = Sys.time(), get_output_data(c("192.168.0.175"))   ) board |> pin_write(rbind(history, new_data), name = "inverter_data", versioned = TRUE) board |> pin_versions("inverter_data")

title: Local Data Collection
text: Now know dynamic behavior, can move R script run regular basis system tools can use edit following file baseline setup (remove) environment variables required script run, finally save modified script accessible folder.

text: system tool crontab tool choice job scheduling linux : Last step configure crontab run every 30 min like following crontab entry
code: crontab -l # m h dom mon dow command 0,30 * * * * R CMD BATCH /path/of/modified/inverter_data.R

title: Local Data Visualization
text: collected values vignette Local Data Collection may nicely visualized, require bit pre-processing formatting.

title: Local Data Visualization
text: time background data collection, now time recall collected data bring light.

title: Local Data Visualization
text: now turn tibble tsibble time-series, order able use time-series specific functions. time-series chosen regular 30 minutes interval, temporarily remove units yet {tsibble} friendly. use fill_gaps() make explicit index entry time series, whenever data exists. Oh, size filled gap tsibble large, missing values comes early data. Now realize around 8% completeness data. require us strong effort imputation.
code: inverter_ts <- inverter_df |>    mutate(time_index = date |> lubridate::floor_date(unit = "30 minutes"),          device_inverter = stringr::str_c(device_id, "_", inverter)) |>   summarize(.by = c(time_index, device_id, inverter, device_inverter),             lifetime_energy = max(lifetime_energy),              today_energy = max(today_energy),              output_power = mean(output_power)) |>    units::drop_units() |>    # convert to time-series   as_tsibble(key = c(device_id, inverter, device_inverter),              index = time_index ) |>    # explicit gaps   fill_gaps()   head(inverter_ts) #> # A tsibble: 6 x 7 [30m] <?> #> # Key:       device_id, inverter, device_inverter [1] #>   time_index          device_id    inverter device_inverter lifetime_energy today_energy output_power #>   <dttm>              <chr>        <chr>    <chr>                     <dbl>        <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1 2024-09-24 19:00:00 E07000011433 1        E07000011433_1             47.0         1.59            6 #> 2 2024-09-24 19:30:00 E07000011433 1        E07000011433_1             47.0         1.59            0 #> 3 2024-09-24 20:00:00 E07000011433 1        E07000011433_1             NA          NA              NA #> 4 2024-09-24 20:30:00 E07000011433 1        E07000011433_1             NA          NA              NA #> 5 2024-09-24 21:00:00 E07000011433 1        E07000011433_1             NA          NA              NA #> 6 2024-09-24 21:30:00 E07000011433 1        E07000011433_1             NA          NA              NA

title: Local Data Visualization
text: lifetime_energy monotonic series, thus correctly imputed linear interpolation. start naive imputation today_energy series delta two steps lifetime_energy. Despite globally correct, far representative daily seasonality photo-voltaic energy production.
code: full_inverter <- inverter_ts |>   # impute 'lifetime_energy' gaps with a linear interpolation   mutate(     lifetime_energy = na_interpolation(lifetime_energy, option = "linear"),     today_energy = if_else(       inverter == lag(inverter),       coalesce(today_energy, lifetime_energy - lag(lifetime_energy)),       today_energy     )   )

title: Local Data Visualization
text: {imputeTS} provides good toolset visualize imputed values time-series :
code: ggplot_na_imputations(x_with_na = inverter_ts |> filter(device_id == "E07000011433") |> pull(lifetime_energy),                       x_with_imputations = full_inverter |> filter(device_id == "E07000011433") |> pull(lifetime_energy),                       ylab = "Total energy [kWh]",                       title = "Imputed Values, first device",                       size_imputations = 0.2,                       size_points = 0.6                       ) ggplot_na_imputations(x_with_na = inverter_ts |> filter(device_id == "E07000011776") |> pull(lifetime_energy),                       x_with_imputations = full_inverter |> filter(device_id == "E07000011776") |> pull(lifetime_energy),                       ylab = "Total energy [kWh]",                       title = "Imputed Values, second device",                       size_imputations = 0.2,                       size_points = 0.6                       ) ggplot_na_imputations(x_with_na = inverter_ts |> filter(device_id == "E07000011433") |> pull(today_energy),                       x_with_imputations = full_inverter |> filter(device_id == "E07000011433") |> pull(today_energy),                       ylab = "Daily energy [kWh]",                       title = "Imputed Values, first device",                       size_imputations = 0.2,                       size_points = 0.6) ggplot_na_imputations(x_with_na = inverter_ts |> filter(device_id == "E07000011776") |> pull(today_energy),                       x_with_imputations = full_inverter |> filter(device_id == "E07000011776") |> pull(today_energy),                       ylab = "Daily energy [kWh]",                       title = "Imputed Values, second device",                       size_imputations = 0.2,                       size_points = 0.6)

title: Local Data Visualization
text: Much better imputation can done course form challenging dataset. everybody knows, intuition daily seasonality modulated local solar radiation. now dig !

title: Collect your Microinverter Data
text: goal microinverterdata provide access local micro-inverter data.

title: Collect your Microinverter Data
text: can install released version CRAN : can install development version {microinverterdata} GitHub :

title: Collect your Microinverter Data
text: basic example get inverter data single device: single device includes 2 separated inverters. get one row data per inverter, .e. per solar panel. can also use vector IP addresses device_ip. Thus command run inverters packages also gives access inverter information get_device_info() inverter internal alarms get_alarm().
code: library(microinverterdata)  ## single micro-inverter device data get_output_data(device_ip = "192.168.0.75") #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   device_id    inverter   output_power today_energy lifetime_energy #>   <chr>        <chr>               [W]         [kW.h]          [kW.h] #> 1 E07000017176 inverter_1          127          0.336            251. #> 2 E07000017176 inverter_2          128          0.342            265. ## multiple inverters data get_output_data(device_ip = c("192.168.0.75", "192.168.0.186")) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   device_id    inverter   output_power today_energy lifetime_energy #>   <chr>        <chr>               [W]         [kW.h]          [kW.h] #> 1 E07000017176 inverter_1          126          0.336           251.  #> 2 E07000017176 inverter_2          128          0.342           265.  #> 3 E07000021746 inverter_1          125          0.334            44.0 #> 4 E07000021746 inverter_2          123          0.329            59.0

title: Collect your Microinverter Data
text: package allow querying values diverse device models model = "..." parameter. {microinverterdata} may require minimal software version configuration supported inverters :

text: Get inverter device alarms

title: Get inverter device alarms — get_alarm
text: device_ip list vector devices IP address model inverter device model. Currently "APSystems" supported.

title: Get inverter device alarms — get_alarm
text: dataframe one row device information per `device_id` answering query.

text: Get inverter device information

title: Get inverter device information — get_device_info
text: device_ip list vector devices IP address model inverter device model. Currently "APSystems" supported.

title: Get inverter device information — get_device_info
text: data-frame one row device information per `device_id` answering query.

title: Get inverter output data — get_output_data
text: Get inverter output data

title: Get inverter output data — get_output_data
text: device_ip list vector devices IP address model inverter device model. Currently "APSystems" "Enphase-Envoy", "Enphase-Energy" "Fronius" supported. ... additional parameters passed inverter needed.

title: Get inverter output data — get_output_data
text: dataframe one row device output power energy per   `device_id` / `inverter` combination.

title: microinverterdata 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-04-14 now perform requests multiple devices parallel (AP System & Fronius). #14 device IP / name validation now stricter. remove lubridate readr dependancy.
